dt: {bc}a plant of any of numerous often cultivated and usually double-flowered varieties or subspecies of an Old World pink ({it}Dianthus caryophyllus{/it}) found in many color variations

et: Middle French, from Old Italian {it}carnagione{/it}, from {it}carne{/it} flesh, from Latin {it}carn-, caro{/it}
shortdef: a plant of any of numerous often cultivated and usually double-flowered varieties or subspecies of an Old World pink (Dianthus caryophyllus) found in many color variations
the variable color of human flesh
